newsitem.title: HONDURAS: Honduran banker Paul Vinelli, 74, dies.
newsitem.headline: Honduran banker Paul Vinelli, 74, dies.

text.p: Paul Vinelli, the president of Honduras's most important banking group, died following open heart surgery, a company spokesman said on Wednesday. He was 74 years old.

Vinelli, one of the most powerful figures in Honduran economics and politics, died Tuesday night following a 12-hour heart operation, said Gilberto Goldstein, another banker with Vinelli's Grupo Atlantida.
"We have lost an important man in the banking and economic life of Honduras," Goldstein said.
Vinelli, who immigrated to Guatemala from Italy in the 1950s, was chairman of the board of Grupo Atlantida, Banco Atlantida and several subsidiaries of the financial group.
In the 1980s, he was kidnapped by a leftist group for several weeks, but was released after paying a ransom.
